ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of right vestibular schwannoma treated with gamma knife radiation; audiogram shows stable asymmetric SNHL consistent with this history.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To monitor stability of hearing sensitivity in a patient with a history of vestibular schwannoma.
To assess speech recognition abilities and functional hearing status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals a stable, asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss. The right ear exhibits severe hearing loss with no measurable speech recognition (historically), consistent with the history of vestibular schwannoma treatment. The left ear shows normal low-frequency hearing sloping to a high-frequency sensorineural loss with excellent speech recognition. Findings are unchanged from the previous evaluation in 2012.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Mild sloping to moderate SNHL (250-500 Hz), sloping to severe (4000-8000 Hz), PTA 67 dB HL. Left ear: Normal (250-500 Hz) sloping to moderately severe SNHL (6000-8000 Hz), PTA 27 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Not measured (DNT). Left ear: SRT 30 dB HL, WRS 96% at 70 dB HL.

proposed_items: Testing after medical management as needed
counseling_actions: Review stability of hearing sensitivity compared to previous tests
Discuss effectiveness of current BiCROS system and HAT

escalation.rationale_short: Patient returned to ENT specialist as scheduled for ongoing monitoring of vestibular schwannoma.
